RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JIMMYTHETOOTH forwardly placed just off the early leader along the inside, advanced to take over command half a mile from home and showed the way through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to prevail. HARD PAR coaxed from the gate, crossed to chase along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, straightened away to the rail before tipping out a furlong out, then ran on willingly to secure the place honors. FILM ACADEMY coaxed from the gate, chased just off the pace three wide down the backstretch and then four to five wide through the turn around the fading I AM DADA MOON coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and kept on to secure the show honors. PRICE IS TRUTH broke in at the start and was corrected, chased just off the inside in aim of the front, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. INSTAMATIC hesitated at the start standing in the gate for a beat as the rest of the field left and then got away lunging awkward and conceded five to six lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased three wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled out six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. SAVAGE SPIRIT was hard to load prior to the start requiring a blindfold, shied in at the start in reaction to PRICE IS TRUTH breaking inwards and bumped SENEGAL solidly into CHARLIE TOUGH and conceded three to four lengths himself to the front, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide for home and stayed on one paced to the finish. BALI AMOUR chased briefly along the inside and then just off the inside until tucked inside once more through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. I AM DADA MOON showed brief speed from the three path leading the way early on until headed near the half mile pole, briefly tucked to the two path and then floated four wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued four wide into upper stretch and tired. SENEGAL got bumped solidly at the start by SAVAGE SPIRIT and in turn bumped CHARLIE TOUGH, conceded three to four lengths to the front, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coaxed along from the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. CHARLIE TOUGH got bumped solidly at the start by SENEGAL due to pressure from SAVAGE SPIRIT and conceded two lengths to the front, chased just off the inside, was in the midst of being tipped out inside the seven-sixteenths when floating three then four wide, got out through the turn and was eased up and placed to a protective hold, then got pulled up in the vicinity of the eighth pole and was subsequently vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Bali Amour
ENTRY.OWNER: Whylie Herold O and Reid Sanchez J
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed inside 3/8, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie Tough
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped solidly st, chased 2p, got out far turn, pulled up, vanned

ENTRY.NAME: Senegal
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped solidly st, chased ins, coax 2p 3/8, 3-4w uppr, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Instamatic
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Savage Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in st, bumped foes, chased 3-2w, 3w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Price Is Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Jimmythetooth
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed ins, up 1/2, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: I Am Dada Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early 3w, headed 1/2p, 4w turn, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Par
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club Dark Horse Racing Stable MacWilliams Patrick O and Cutair Ra
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, ran on, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Film Academy
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w backstretch, 4-5w turn, 4w upper, kept on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1M Inner turf CR: 83. Claiming Purse 55000. INNER TURF (UP TO $9,570 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS SAN GABRIEL went to the front, showed the way while inside to the two path, responded well when asked outside the quarter-pole, held a clear advantage under a strong hand-ride into the final furlong then came under a right-handed crop and held under strong urging. TAP IT UP was well placed just off the pace on the inside, came under encouragement on the far turn, moved to the two path outside the quarter-pole, chased the winner under a drive in the stretch and just held the place. LADY JASMINE was hustled from the gate, stalked the pace on the outside in the two to three path, was given her cue on the final turn, chased the top two while remaining on her inside lead to the sixteenth-pole, swapped to the proper lead at that point and just missed the place while clear for the show. ANILEATE threw her head to the outside while away awkwardly then bumped with an opponent, lugged in some on the initial straightaway, was taken up off heels while near two bumping foes into the first turn, went three wide going around that bend, was reserved on the outside but with the benefit of cover, went three then four wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick. FROSTY INVASION bumped hard with an opponent into the first turn, rounded that bend in the two path, was rated off the pace, moved in nearing the half-mile pole, saved ground while roused on the far turn and also lacked the needed kick. SNOW LOVES A FIGHT was taken under tight restraint early, went three wide on the first turn, was rated near the middle of the field, came under urging in the two path on the far turn, moved out under a drive in upper stretch and failed to rally. SISTER NELL was taken under a tight hold early then reserved under stout restraint in the two path, came under urging near the quarter-pole and also failed to rally. HARLAN'S BOND bumped with a rival at the start, went three wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace, traveled three wide while asked on the far turn, was driven four wide int the stretch and lacked the needed response. POUT bumped hard with a foe into the first turn then checked sharply along the rail early on that bend, dropped well behind while saving ground, came out into the stretch and was eased but walked off. THE THREE-QUARTER FRACTION WAS HAND-TIMED DUE TO A TIMING ISSUE AND PROVIDED BY THE NYRA STEWARD

ENTRY.NAME: Pout
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard 7/8,checked sharply,inside turns,eased,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Miss San Gabriel
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V Madaket Stables LLC and ERJ Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,inside-2path,asked outside 1/4,responded,held driving

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Nell
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,2p1st,reserved,pulled1/2,2p2nd,ask1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Tap It Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside,asked 2nd turn,2path1/4,chased,held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty Invasion
ENTRY.OWNER: Rosenthal Robert D Greenberg Martin and Rosenthal Peter
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard 7/8,2p1st,rated,mvd in1/2,ins2nd,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Bond
ENTRY.OWNER: Carney Sean Donk David G and Mackay Douglas R
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,3w1st,rated,ask3w2nd,4w1/4,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Anileate
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkwrd,bmpd brk,taken up 7/8,3p1st,rated,3-4w2nd,5w1/4,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Jasmine
ENTRY.OWNER: Donk David G Behrendt John T Marquis Charles K Haslup Suzanne K Carney Sean Punk
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,stalked outside,2-3path,ask2nd turn,chsd,missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Snow Loves a Fight
ENTRY.OWNER: Noda Orlando and Final Turn Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,rated 3-2path,ask2nd turn,mvd out ins3/16,no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 50000. (UP TO $8,700 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS FILLIES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000 (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IT TAKES HEART two to three wide in pursuit, advanced on the leader midway on the turn given a notch to work with, took over command nearing the quarter pole and swung three to four wide into upper stretch, then went clear under a drive kept to task. ARELLA STAR coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing just off the inside midway on the turn under threat to the outside, got collared nearing the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while keeping on to secure the place honors clear of the rest. TRY IT AGAIN stumbled at the start, chased along the inside down the backstretch, floated to the two path when placed to coaxing near the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch and tired. SISTER SUPREAM coaxed from the gate, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch, tired. BRISKY FROLIC coaxed from the start, chased two to three wide down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, went five wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Try It Again
ENTRY.OWNER: Arenas Marcelo Giangrande Salvatore and Giangrande Stefano
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased ins, coaxed 2p 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Arella Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed 2p 3/8, collared, 2w 1/4, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Brisky Frolic
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 4w 3/8, 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Supream
ENTRY.OWNER: Gorham Jr Robert M and Gorham Michael E
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4w, coaxed 7/16, 2-3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: It Takes Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, advanced 3/8, up 3-4w upper, went clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 42000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REIGNING CHICK showed speed on the outside then chased the leading duo, went around the turn in the three path, gained four wide into the stretch then took over around the three-sixteenths, kicked clear shortly thereafter then was put to a right-handed crop, switched to a left-handed crop while still clear outside the sixteenth-pole and held under strong urging. MERAVIGLIOSO was urged along off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn, was driven five wide into upper stretch, chased the winner outside into the final furlong, gained into the final sixteenth but missed while clear for the place. VITAEMI was fractious in the gate, bumped solidly with a rival at the start, showed good speed on the inside, dueled inside of a foe while along the rail, passed the five-sixteenths with a solo advantage, was roused for more coming to the quarter-pole, spun a bit off the inside into upper stretch, was headed near the three-sixteenths, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened but was clear for the show. GRINGOTTS was restless in the gate, stumbled at the start, was urged along at the rear, saved ground on the turn, swung four wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. BACKED BY GOLD broke a step slow then was hustled, was taken in hand briefly while crowded between foes early, raced near the back under urging, went three wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. GAME THEORY bobbled at the start, dropped back on the outside under urging, went four wide on the turn and failed to respond. BEAUTIFUL KAREN was restless in the gate, bumped solidly with an opponent at the start, dueled on the outside of a foe, vied in the two path on the turn, dropped back at the five-sixteenths and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Vitaemi
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,bmpd brk,speed,duel ins foe,rail turn,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Beautiful Karen
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Rudy R Imperio Michael and Scuderi Vincent S
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate,bumped start,dueled outside foe,2p turn,stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Gringotts
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate,stumbled brk,urged,inside trn,swung 4w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Backed by Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Thummps Racing Stable LLC and Jacoutot Peter
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,hustled,in hand,3path turn,5w into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Meraviglioso
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,2-4path turn,5w1/4,chased,gained late,missed,clr2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Reigning Chick
ENTRY.OWNER: Walder Peter R EKB Stables LLC and Surging Sky Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,chased duo outside,3path turn,4p1/4,lead3/16,clr1/8,held

ENTRY.NAME: Game Theory
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled brk,drop back outside,4wide turn,no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. INNER TURF (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTION AL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred )(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISE EN SCENE (GB) got bumped and brushed at the start when SAIL BY broke outwards and PLEASANT PASSAGE came inwards slightly, settled just off the inside near the rear of the field, slipped briefly four then three wide nearing the five-sixteenths when BEAUTE CACHEE came off the fence to the two path inside and in front, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, closed well outside and was just up in the final jumps to the finish. BEAUTE CACHEE (FR) forward from the break, got taken under a hold when MISS CAROL ANN crossed directly in front into the first turn and skygazed a bit a rank under the restraint before settling to track inside through the rest of the bend and down the backstretch, remained on hold until slipping out subtly to the two path near the five-sixteenths, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive steadily gaining on the leader to take command seventy yards from home, then got nailed in the last strides to the line. PLEASANT PASSAGE came in slightly at the start brushing with MISE EN SCENE, saved ground in pursuit from mid pack, came under light coaxing at the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch and was under urging tipping out slightly to the two path when clear of the backing away VERONICA GREENE a furlong from home as the leader closed down the inside seam some making it a tight lane, had to pause just off that rival's hind end a sixteenth out unable to tip out with a pair of foes there before gaining clearance to the inside of MISS CAROL ANN, altered in roused and offered up a mild bid to secure the show honors in the shadow the wire. MISS CAROL ANN (IRE) established the front shortly after the start and crossed to the inside into the first turn, showed the way under rating along the inside under attendance from VERONICA GREENE to the outside but facing little pressure save from her presence, remained patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive under threat and succumbed to it seventy yards from home, then got out-finished in the final jumps for the show honors while clear of the rest. SAIL BY broke out at the start bumping MISE EN SCENE and then was bumped back due to pressure from PLEASANT PASSAGE and found herself in behind BEAUTE CACHEE, grew rank along the inside under restraint in behind rivals off heels, took to the two path into the backstretch before tucking back inside five furlongs from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly by mostly tired rivals. VERONICA GREENE three wide through the first turn, attended the leader from the outside in the two path, came under coaxing with five-sixteenths to go, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. BRAMBLE BAY two to three wide in pursuit, got coaxed along three furlongs out, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Beaute Cachee (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Louis Lazzinnaro LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: skygazed 7/8, tracked ins, to 2p 5/16, 3w uppr, led late, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Sail By
ENTRY.OWNER: Lindy Farms and Ice Wine Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out, bumped st, rank early ins, coaxed 3/8, 4w uppr, belated

ENTRY.NAME: Mise En Scene (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, brushed st, 2-3w pursuit, 3-4w uppr, closed well, up

ENTRY.NAME: Pleasant Passage
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd mid pack, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, paused 1/16, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Bramble Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Carol Ann (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated on pace ins, set down 2w 1/4p, dug in, caught 70yds out

ENTRY.NAME: Veronica Greene
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, attended 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALDWELL LUVS GOLD broke near the back of the field, climbed into the kickback early, was urged along well off the pace, moved out late on the backstretch, went three to four wide on the turn, angled out in upper stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and closed strongly to win going away. FOCUS POCUS broke in and bumped with a foe, chased the pace on the outside, engaged the leader in the three path on the turn, was roused nearing the quarter-pole, took the lead into upper stretch, led under a drive until near the sixteenth-pole then was overtaken while clear for the place. LADY ARWEN broke a step slow then was taken up while having her path taken, moved up under urging, gained four wide on the turn, chased the runner-up under a drive into the final furlong and weakened but was clear for the show. KANT CALL IT broke out and bumped with a foe, moved up to take the lead, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, lost the advantage into upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired. GRAB THE GLORY was away fast, showed speed then chased the pace, saved ground on the turn and came up empty. DREAMERY was hustled from the start then ridden along towards the rear, started the turn in the two path, was taken up inside the five-sixteenths then moved to the three path, was carried four wide outside the quarter-pole then spun five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. POSEIDON'S MIST was hustled from the gate then urged along off the pace, dropped back near the nine-sixteenths, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch and was no factor. REGENERATOR was fractious leaving the paddock path and onto the main-track, departed the gate under urging, went around the turn in the two path and failed to respond. ARCHIVIST was hustled from the start, dropped back under urging on the far outside, fell well behind in the six path on the turn and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Poseidon's Mist
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,urged,drop back 9/16,ins-3p turn,4w into lane,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamery
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,well back,taken up inside 7/16,5w into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Caldwell Luvs Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk near back,climbed early,well back,mvd out1/2,3-4w trn,rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Regenerator
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious onto track,hustled,urged,2path turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Grab the Glory
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke fast,hustled,speed,chased,inside turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Kant Call It
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,speed,pace,2p turn,headed into upper,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Arwen
ENTRY.OWNER: Allread Neal M and Gold Star Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,tkn up,mvd up,urged,gain 4w turn,chased,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Focus Pocus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brady Horse Racing and Rusba V Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd,chsd outside,bid 3path turn,led3/16-1/8,overtaken

ENTRY.NAME: Archivist
ENTRY.OWNER: Grant Joseph M Marsh Greg A Can Do Racing LLC Walsh Steven M and Chichakly Amira
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,dropped back outside,6w turn,faltered,eased,wlkd off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1 1/16M Turf CR: 101. Claiming Purse 60000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EYES ON TARGET got bumped at the start in a chain of small bumps begun by CONTINENTAL DIVIDE, tracked the front from just off the inside in mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, was under a light drive in behind the top pair just off the inside, had the rider look to the outside, tipped out into a space three to four paths off the rail forcing TARTINI to check between to pinching foes and TOMMY BEE who was attempting to angle in to the seam from the outside to pause and steady in behind and to the outside of TARTINI, then rallied into the open lane and was just up in the final jumps to prevail. LANDBISCUIT three then two wide through the first turn, attended the leader to the outside in the two path, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive knocking heads with MICROSECOND through to inside the eighth pole when taking narrow command nearing the sixteenth marker, then got nailed in the very last strides to the finish. KLICKITAT settled just off the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, rallied outside rivals and missed at the finish. MICROSECOND four wide into the first turn, tucked to the inside when clearing rivals to show the way in hand along the rail under attendance to the outside and under some pressure from that rival, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch under challenge, dug in head to head through to inside the eighth pole, got collared nearing the sixteenth pole and weakened in the very late stages. TOMMY BEE coaxed from the start, tracked the pace along the inside through to the far turn when tipped out two then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive behind foes and spied an opening nearing the sixteenth marker to the inside and briefly came in to head for it when forced to steady as EYES ON TARGET beat him to the lane and tipped out, brushed with TARTINI who was forced to check at that station with pressure from both sides, then kept on evenly to the finish having lost about a length of position to the incident. SPEEDY HANS three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and kept on to the finish but was outkicked. CUPID'S CLAWS got bumped at the start by CONTINENTAL DIVIDE and in turn bumped EYES ON TARGET into GOLDINI, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued two to three wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. TARTINI tracked the pace along the inside from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and had TOMMY BEE attempt to tip inwards in front from behind KLICKITAT to an open seam as EYES ON TARGET tipped out from in behind the top pair at the same moment, got forced to check from that losing momentum and position as a result near the sixteenth pole as TOMMY BEE bumped him and steadied to his outside, and couldn't recover to the finish. HUGE BIGLY coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled six wide into upper stretch and made no headway. GOLDINI bumped at the start in a chain of bumps, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home and weakened. CONTINENTAL DIVIDE broke out at the start commencing a chain of small bumps out through GOLDINI, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung five wide for home and trailed throughout. There was a Jockey's Objection by the rider of TARTINI alleging interference against EYES ON TARGET in the stretch run. After review, it was deemed that EYES ON TARGET had indeed interfered with TARTINI and was therefore disqualified and placed eighth before the result was declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: Continental Divide
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w uppr, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Cupid's Claws
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable LLC Wachtel Stable and Barber Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Eyes On Target
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, tracked 2p, 3w uppr, impeded foe near 1/16, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Goldini
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez, Rudy R. and Imperio, Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Huge Bigly
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Bee
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked ins, coax 3w 5/16, 4w uppr, steady 1/16p

ENTRY.NAME: Tartini
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, checked, impeded near 1/16p

ENTRY.NAME: Klickitat
ENTRY.OWNER: JohLis Racing LLC and Daly Double Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 2p, coaxed 5/16, angled 5w upper, rallied, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Speedy Hans
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5-6w upper, kept on, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Landbiscuit
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, attended 2p, 2w 1/4p, dug in, up near 1/16, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Microsecond
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w into 1st turn, in hand ins, ins 1/4, collared near 1/16, wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Birdstone S. SARATOGA RACE 8 1 3/4M Dirt CR: 107. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. Fo r horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4%t o fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of such a race in 2022 allowed 4 lbs.; of a sweepstake at a mile or over since September 1, 2022 2 or two races other than maiden claiming, starter or State-bred allowance at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, July 15, 2023 with 15 Original Nominations and 1 Supplement.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEXT stalked the pace on the outside in the two path while traveling comfortably, took over with three furlongs to run, moved clear at the five-sixteenths, extended the advantage while shaken up into upper stretch, was given one light tap of a right-handed crop at the furlong marker, drew away while kept to the task into the final seventy yards and proved much the best under a mild hand-ride to the finish. TIME FOR TROUBLE bumped with a rival at the start, was reserved at the rear while two to three wide, gained under urging on the final turn, shifted four wide before the five-sixteenths, was driven five wide into the stretch, drifted in while outside of a foe inside the furlong marker and safely secured the place. DASH ATTACK broke out and bumped with a foe, settled while inside to the two path, chased on the final turn, was driven four wide into the stretch, drifted in inside the furlong marker and weakened but was clear for the show. THE SKIPPER TOO dropped back early, was reserved in the two path for the first two turns, settled kindly down the backstretch, was roused with a half-mile to run, went four then five wide on the final turn, dropped to the three path outside the quarter-pole and failed to respond. SEA FOAM was coaxed to the front, showed the way on the inside with a clear advantage, lost the lead midway through the final turn and faded. LONE ROCK tugged on the bit under restraint into the first turn, went two to three wide on that bend, settled on the outside in three path, was urged along on the backstretch, dropped back three wide on the final turn and faltered then was eased but walked off. TREASURE TROVE was last to commence then dropped back, saved ground at the rear and also faltered then was eased but walked off. ALL TIMES WERE HAND-TIMED DUE TO A TIMING ISSUE AND PROVIDED BY THE NYRA STEWARD

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. INNER TURF (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE O F $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare As sessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIONEERING SPIRIT saved ground in pursuit from mid pack early on, tipped two to three wide down the backstretch, came under coaxing just off the inside at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command nearing the eighth pole, edged clear under a drive to prevail. GOOD SKATE settled just off the inside near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to secure the place honors. DRIPPING GOLD coaxed from the gate, raced forwardly placed just off the inside in closest aim of the leader until overtaken by a spurting away HIGH TIDE, tracked that rival in tandem with SPACE LAUNCH into the second turn and the backstretch, inherited the front as that rival backed out with five furlongs to go, showed the way along the inside, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was caught near the eighth pole, ran on to preserve the show honors. SERIFOS saved ground in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and improved position for the last major share. SPACE LAUNCH coaxed from the gate, led early on along the inside until displaced by a spurting rival, tracked along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. ONENIGHTSTANDARDS coaxed from the start, tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and weakened, then got vanned off after the finish. MERLIN two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing and bid at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. ROYNE three wide early on, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and made no impact. NONEEDTOWORRY chased three to four wide until tucked inside into the final turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and tired. HIGH TIDE five wide through the first turn, pulled his way advancing outside rivals four wide past the stands to take command near the sixteenth pole the initial time around, went three wide through the second turn spurting away, yielded the front with five-furlongs to go while seven to eight paths off the inside down the backstretch, was eased along to a gallop and went five to six wide through the far and final turn and then continued to be eased home to the finish well behind but walked off under his own power.

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, led early ins, displaced, tracked ins, 2w 1/4p, wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 5 1/2F Turf CR: 101. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOSUA SUMMER settled near the middle of the field, moved from the rail to the two path on the turn, swung four wide into the stretch, rallied on the outside, drifted in some while closing fast inside the furlong marker, gained the advantage inside the sixteenth-pole and prevailed under strong handling. SOUPER QUEST went to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside to the two path on the turn, was asked into the stretch then extended the advantage, responded well under the crop into the final furlong, swapped back to his inside lead while still in front coming to the sixteenth-pole and was caught but earned the place. RICHY chased the pace down the backstretch, saved ground on the turn, pursued the top two under a drive in the stretch and finished with good courage for the show. MACKILLOP dropped back while ridden along, went around the turn in the two path, shifted three wide into the stretch, moved out near the three-sixteenths and improved position. FAMOUS GENT stumbled at the start, was urged along near the back, moved in late on the backstretch, shifted from the rail to the three path early on the turn, was driven five wide into the stretch and failed to rally. TIVY was hustled from the start then urged along on the outside, went four wide on the turn, spun five wide into the stretch and tired. THREE ZERO bumped twice with an opponent at the start, settled under some urging, went three then two wide on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch, steadied between foes at the sixteenth-pole and failed to threaten. AWESOME NATIVE bumped twice with an opponent at the start, was urged along at the rear, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. CHARGING chased the pace on the outside then three wide on the turn and capitulated.

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled mid-pack,ins-2p turn,4path1/4,rallied,up final 1/16
